benchmark_details.name: Concept Learning Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: A dataset of concept learning tasks that helps uncover implicit biases in large language models, specifically studying biases towards upward monotonicity in quantifiers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate how large language models process unknown concepts with different semantic monotonicity properties and uncover implicit biases.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Only a limited set of LLMs were tested; hope to apply the concept learning methodology to study a larger set of models with greater variety as future work.

data.source: Linguistic items and numerical data generated based on labeled examples derived from concept learning tasks.

methodology.calculation: Compared the model's computed probabilities of positive and negative responses to evaluate accuracy.
methodology.interpretation: If P(prompt+'Yes') > P(prompt+'No') then a positive response is considered.
methodology.validation: Compared results across multiple variations of model responses to establish consistency.
